subject: AI
title: What Is a Neural Network?
description: Layers, weights, and how they combine to make predictions.

hook.text: Everyone says 'neural network' like it's magic. Under the hood, it's just multiply, add, and squish â€” repeated a lot.

buildup.text: A neural network is layers of nodes. Each node takes inputs, multiplies by weights, adds a bias, and applies a function. Layer by layer, simple math builds complex patterns.

discovery.text: The first layer might detect edges in an image. The next layer combines edges into shapes. The last layer says 'that's a dog.' Each layer builds on the previous one.

twist.text: Despite the name, neural networks barely resemble biological neurons. The name is marketing from the 1940s. What matters is the math, not the metaphor.

climax.text: Think of a neural network as a chain of simple transformations. Each one is trivial; together, they approximate incredibly complex functions.

punchline.text: Not magic, not brains â€” just stacked math that gets surprisingly powerful.

options: Stores a copy of the training data
